snippet: Regarding admissions criteria and recruitment policies, Traub writes, ''Conservatives think that fiddling undermines the principle of merit.'' But fiddling with an eye to changing the racial and ethnic mix is also illegal discrimination. It is no ...
lead_paragraph: Regarding admissions criteria and recruitment policies, Traub writes, ''Conservatives think that fiddling undermines the principle of merit.'' But fiddling with an eye to changing the racial and ethnic mix is also illegal discrimination. It is no different from de-emphasizing the S.A.T. because too many Jews do well on it, or avoiding recruitment in Chinatown.
abstract: Center for Equal Opportunity official Linda Chavez letter on James Traub's May 2 article on affirmative action policies in California; says too many children, primarily black and Hispanic, get poor support at home and attend inadequate public schools that prevent them from competing for admission to top colleges
